passages.text: China (PRC) | Internet IGG
Quick Take: IGG 1H25 Rlits

IGG reported 1H results with revenue coming in below expectations due mainly to softer- than- expected gaming and APP business. Earnings beat on lower- than- expected costs (e.g. S&M). During conference call, management highlights flagship title Lords Mobile to have major upgrade in Nov/Dec. Ongoing refinements are made for other games Doomsday and Viking Rise. Newly launched Fate War exceeds expectations. Al is applied in content generation to improve efficiency.

1H25 results review. Total revenue was flattish YoY to HKD2.7bn (5.2% and 7.1% below consensus and our estimates, respectively). By game, Doomsday: Last Survivors and Viking Rise increased by about 6.2% YoY and 18.1% YoY to HKD524m and HKD364m, respectively, contributing about 19.2% and 13.4% of total revenue. The two games combined increased in revenue contribution from 30% in 2024 to about 32.6% in 1H25. Flagship game Lords Mobile revenue (42.2% of total) declined by about 14.3% YoY to HKD1.15bn. Gross profit increased 4.7% YoY to HKD2.3bn and GPM expanded by 4pp to 83% due mainly to continued optimisation of operating cost and revenue contribution from app business. S&M expenses increased by 10% YoY to HKD1.3bn due mainly to increased marketing expense to enhance user acquisition and extend product life spans. Net income reached HKD325m (vs consensus at HKD312.5m and our estimate of HKD316m), of which the core game business generated about HKD344.4m and investment loss reached (HKD19.7m).

Key takeaways from conference call. These include: (1) Games performance: (a) Lords Mobile: As of Jun 2025, it had 770mn registered users and 7.7mn MAU. To extend the game's lifecycle, a major update is scheduled in upcoming Nov and Dec to reactivate user engagement and monetization; (b) Doomsday: After the continuous testing and optimization, retention and monetization metrics surpassed expectations in Jul and revenue seen a strong rebound in Aug. The revenue growth is expected to reach a new high in Dec 25 or Jan 26 supported by a major IP collaboration in Dec; (c) Viking Rise: the monthly gross billings were around US \(6m at the start of 2025 with ongoing feature adjustments, Co is targeting US\) 10m per month by Dec; (d) Newly launched game Fate War: It exceeded expectations, generating HKD 200m gross billings within 3 weeks of Jmch and reaching 1.2m MAU with healthy retention. The average retention rate is 30% with 40% in Japan. User acquisition cost is lower than expected at around USD 3 per new user, leading to a faster payback cycle; (2) New games: a) a gangster-themed game that has been testing for two years. It already demonstrated its organic appeal for certain marketsb) a survival game, developed over three years, is scheduled for launch in late November 2025; (3) App Business: Despite weaker 1H ad spend, Co accumulated users aggressively at lower cost. It expects an acceleration in 2H25 and MAU targets to exceed 100m in 2026; (4) Al application. Over 70% of ad creatives and 40% of video assets are Al- generated now. Co aims to integrate Al into game planning and coding for further cost savings and efficiency; (5) Co planned to invest around USD 30mn to promote Fate War in 2H25 with overall profitability to remain solid; (6) Headcount will stay steady in 2025, with plans to add around 200 people in Southeast Asia in 2026; (7) Shareholder return: The interim dividend declared, together with the share repurchase program, represented approximately 61% of the Group's 2025 interim net profit.

We would like to thank Fiona Fan, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report. We would like to thank Han Wang, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report We would like to thank Erica Qiu, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.
IGG IGG Inc. is an online games developer and operator. The company offers multi- language browser games, client- based games and mobile games to players globally.

We have a Buy rating with PT of HKD4.5 based on 2025E EPS of HKD0.54 and P/E of 8.3. Risks include: (1) performance of LM falls below expectations; (2) unsuccessful release of new games; (3) aggressive sales and marketing with low ROI.
(Article 3(1) and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published, - - Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold desribes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. Expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.

NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company. Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
IGG Inc (799 HK: HK\$4.30, BUY)

Notes: Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.

D: Dropped Coverage
